subject: Re: [junit] Customizing the Junit Reports
msgSnippet: On Thu, 02 Sep 2004 15:07:18 -0000, Bill Oliver  ... Have you tried adding a TestListener? -- Jason Rogers I am crucified with Christ:
messageBody:
On Thu, 02 Sep 2004 15:07:18 -0000, Bill Oliver <bill.oliver@...>
wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I'm using Junit as a test harness for some non-Java tests. To be
> precise, Junit drives a file comparison operation and if the output
> file is different from the benchmark file, an error is produced.
>
> All of this works fine, but I would like to over-ride the output that
> appears in the TYPE column of the report. Specifically I would like
> to hide the traceback and add my own custom text. Ideally, this
> custom text would include a hyperlink.

Have you tried adding a TestListener?

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
